  3. Stuc a' Chroin

Stuc a' Chroin

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Stuc a' Chroin is a steep and rocky peak, involving a scramble when ascended (as is common) from neighbouring Ben Vorlich.

 You have not climbed Stuc a' Chroin.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 975 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.81/5
Rating: 3.8/5 (180 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ben Vorlich and Stuc a' Chroin from Ardvorlich

Beinn Each route (can be extended to Stuc a' Chroin

Other routes and challenges

Other options for the ascent include a route from the south via Arivurichardich then up the southeast ridge. It also also possible to to aproach up Glen Ample and heading up to the Bealach an Dubh-Chorein, or from the head of Glen Artney.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)

There are 10094 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Stuc a' Chroin. They have contributed 176 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
